problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following describes the interaction between like electric charges?
options: They have no force between them
problems.detailed: Like charges (both positive or both negative) repel one another.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the SI unit of electric charge?
problems.hint: It’s the unit for transferred charge.
problems.detailed: The SI unit of electric charge is the coulomb (C), representing the charge transferred by a current of one ampere in one second.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the charge of an electron (approximately)?
problems.detailed: An electron carries a charge of approximately - \(1.6 \times 10^{-19}\) coulombs.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which statement best describes conservation of charge?
options: Charge can be created but not destroyed
Charge can be destroyed but not created
Charge can be created and destroyed
Charge cannot be created or destroyed
problems.detailed: Charge is conserved—it cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred from one object to another.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is meant by charge quantization?
options: Charge exists in a smooth continuum
problems.detailed: Charge is quantized, meaning it exists in discrete packets, the smallest being the charge of a proton or electron.
